intro: Mazus wanmuliensis, commonly known as the Wanmul Island Mazus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Wanmul in China. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features hairy, ovate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with five petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
